00037 /************************** PRIVATE DEFINITIONS *********************/
00038 // PORT number that /CS pin assigned on
00039 #define CS_PORT_NUM             0
00040 // PIN number that  /CS pin assigned on
00041 #define CS_PIN_NUM              16
00042 #define SPI_DATABIT_SIZE                10
00043 
00045 #define BUFFER_SIZE                     0x40
00046 
00047 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLES *************************/
00048 uint8_t menu1[] =
00049 "********************************************************************************\n\r"
00050 "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"
00051 "SPI demo \n\r"
00052 "\t - MCU: LPC17xx \n\r"
00053 "\t - Core: ARM Cortex-M3 \n\r"
00054 "\t - Communicate via: UART0 - 115200bps \n\r"
00055 "\t An example of SPI using interrupt mode to test the SPI driver \n\r"
00056 " This example uses SPI in master mode to communicate with SPI slave device \n\r"
00057 " The master and slave transfer together a number of data byte \n\r"

00061 // SPI Configuration structure variable
00062 SPI_CFG_Type SPI_ConfigStruct;
00063 
00064 #if (SPI_DATABIT_SIZE == 8)
00065 uint8_t Tx_Buf[BUFFER_SIZE];
00066 uint8_t Rx_Buf[BUFFER_SIZE];
00067 #else
00068 uint16_t Tx_Buf[BUFFER_SIZE];
00069 uint16_t Rx_Buf[BUFFER_SIZE];
00070 #endif

00073 void CS_Init(void);

00080 /*-------------------------PRIVATE FUNCTIONS------------------------------*/
00081 /*********************************************************************/
00087 void CS_Init(void)
00088 {
00089         GPIO_SetDir(CS_PORT_NUM, (1<<CS_PIN_NUM), 1);
00090         GPIO_SetValue(CS_PORT_NUM, (1<<CS_PIN_NUM));
00091 }
00092 
00093 
00094 /*********************************************************************/
00102 void CS_Force(int32_t state)
00103 {
00104         if (state){
00105                 GPIO_SetValue(CS_PORT_NUM, (1<<CS_PIN_NUM));
00106         }else{
00107                 GPIO_ClearValue(CS_PORT_NUM, (1<<CS_PIN_NUM));
00108         }
00109 }
00110 
00111 /*********************************************************************/
00116 void Buffer_Init(void)
00117 {
00118         uint8_t i;
00119 #if (SPI_DATABIT_SIZE == 8)
00120         for (i = 0; i < BUFFER_SIZE; i++) {
00121                 Tx_Buf[i] = i;
00122                 Rx_Buf[i] = 0;
00123         }
00124 #else
00125         for (i = 0; i < BUFFER_SIZE/2; i++) {
00126                 Tx_Buf[i] = i;
00127                 Rx_Buf[i] = 0;
00128         }
00129 #endif
00130 }
00131 
00132 /*********************************************************************/
00137 void Error_Loop(void)
00138 {
00139         /* Loop forever */
00140         while (1);
00141 }
00142 
00143 /*********************************************************************/
00148 void Buffer_Verify(void)
00149 {
00150         uint8_t i;
00151 #if (DATA_SIZE==8)
00152         uint8_t *src_addr = (uint8_t *) &Tx_Buf[0];
00153         uint8_t *dest_addr = (uint8_t *) &Rx_Buf[0];
00154         for ( i = 0; i < SPI_DATABIT_SIZE; i++ )
00155         {
00156                 if ( *src_addr++ != *dest_addr++ )
00157                 {
00158                         /* Call Error Loop */
00159                         _DBG_("Verify error");
00160                         Error_Loop();
00161                 }
00162         }
00163 #else
00164         uint16_t *src_addr = (uint16_t *) &Tx_Buf[0];
00165         uint16_t *dest_addr = (uint16_t *) &Rx_Buf[0];
00166         for ( i = 0; i < SPI_DATABIT_SIZE/2; i++ )
00167         {
00168                 if ( *src_addr++ != *dest_addr++ )
00169                 {
00170                         /* Call Error Loop */
00171                         _DBG_("Verify error");
00172                         Error_Loop();
00173                 }
00174         }
00175 #endif
00176 }
00177 
00178 /*********************************************************************/
00183 void print_menu(void)
00184 {
00185         _DBG(menu1);
00186 }

00188 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00189 /*********************************************************************/
00194 int c_entry(void)
00195 {
00196         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00197         SPI_DATA_SETUP_Type xferConfig;
00198         uint32_t tmp;
00199 
00200         /*
00201          * Initialize SPI pin connect
00202          * P0.15 - SCK;
00203          * P0.16 - SSEL - used as GPIO
00204          * P0.17 - MISO
00205          * P0.18 - MOSI
00206          */
00207         PinCfg.Funcnum = 3;
00208         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00209         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00210         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00211         PinCfg.Pinnum = 15;
00212         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00213         PinCfg.Pinnum = 17;
00214         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00215         PinCfg.Pinnum = 18;
00216         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00217         PinCfg.Pinnum = 16;
00218         PinCfg.Funcnum = 0;
00219         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00220 
00221         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00222          * – 115200bps
00223          * – 8 data bit
00224          * – No parity
00225          * – 1 stop bit
00226          * – No flow control
00227          */
00228         debug_frmwrk_init();
00229 
00230         // print welcome screen
00231         print_menu();
00232 
00233         SPI_ConfigStruct.CPHA = SPI_CPHA_SECOND;
00234         SPI_ConfigStruct.CPOL = SPI_CPOL_LO;
00235         SPI_ConfigStruct.ClockRate = 2000000;
00236         SPI_ConfigStruct.DataOrder = SPI_DATA_MSB_FIRST;
00237         SPI_ConfigStruct.Databit = SPI_DATABIT_SIZE;
00238         SPI_ConfigStruct.Mode = SPI_MASTER_MODE;
00239         // Initialize SPI peripheral with parameter given in structure above
00240         SPI_Init(LPC_SPI, &SPI_ConfigStruct);
00241 
00242         _DBG_("Press '1' to start transfer...");
00243 
00244         while (_DG != '1');
00245 
00246         _DBG_("Init buffer");
00247         /* Initialize Buffer */
00248         Buffer_Init();
00249 
00250         CS_Init();
00251 
00252         _DBG_("Start transfer...");
00253         CS_Force(0);
00254         // delay for a while
00255         for (tmp = 10000; tmp; tmp--);
00256         xferConfig.tx_data = Tx_Buf;
00257         xferConfig.rx_data = Rx_Buf;
00258         xferConfig.length = BUFFER_SIZE;
00259         SPI_ReadWrite(LPC_SPI, &xferConfig, SPI_TRANSFER_POLLING);
00260         // delay for a while
00261         for (tmp = 10000; tmp; tmp--);
00262         CS_Force(1);
00263         _DBG_("Complete!");
00264 
00265         // Verify buffer after transferring
00266         Buffer_Verify();
00267         _DBG_("Verify complete!");
00268         SPI_DeInit(LPC_SPI);
00269     /* Loop forever */
00270     while(1);
00271     return 1;
00272 }
00273 
00274 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00275    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00276    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00277    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00278    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00279 int main(void)
00280 {
00281     return c_entry();
00282 }
